column5: YA YA YA......  NICE AN ALL BUT GET BACK TO BUILDING MY ROD!  Cheers!  PS: Patiently waiting....... don't know if I want you to tease me with pictures or not........

those rods aren't going to like down easter's very much!!!  nice work spiel! That just made my whole body cringe!  Very nice heirloom work as always Chris, truly master pieces, cant believe the colours, and grains of some of the exotic wood reel seats When I chose my reel seat, that was the toughest thing to choose. You have got to see these seat blanks up close. Well you will be able to see his quality work up close the next time we meet up on the river.  He's just marking which one is his so he doesn't get them mixed up Art!!!  The workmanship just keeps getting better and better... I think you may have hit the end of the spectrum though Chris! Actually, that is mine! All mine I say! lol I feel honoured to have what I believe is the first Spiel burnt sig.  Now guys quit praising him, at least until he is done building mine! ha ha ha  Cheers, Ron...

I have a few of Spiel's creations.  I don't have any of those luxury reel seats. Main reason being that I use Downeasters.  Got some pretty fancy thread work though. Every one of his rods are go to rods for me though.
Works of art for sure!!!
Don't make me take my reel off and check,   maybe behind all those minnow scales. You know I'll be knocking for an autograph  . Great work bud, still want that gold coin job that we talked about.
Craftsmanship is alive and extremely well....
Great minds think alike!  Nice work! Too snazzy for me, I just break everything! Lol  S.
So ...uhmmmm... whatcha been doin lately..  Beautiful seats man ...wow...I use stuff too hard to even consider ..  Happy New Year

Happy New Year to you as well Chris. Is that what you daydreamed about sitting up in the crane cab?  Works of art. Wish I could afford one. Any company discount???  We had a Gord Loomis from Utilities 25 years back, man time flies. He was from Mt. Hope as well. Same guy? He said he was. The guys loved pulling my chain sometimes.  1st Monday of every month 09:00 at The Egg and I for breakfast is a monthly get together for the Blast Furnace guys, Upper James if you have time sometime. I don't go often, no calendar here anymore. What's today?
Super impressive Chris.  You're hands are very talented!!!
Your creations are awesome!
Thanks everyone, truly appreciated.  I'm not out of ideas yet and have some new designs in the making, I'll update when I think I've got a worthy result.
Very nice work Spiel as said.!!,would love one as well someday(soon).
Very, very nice!  Fine talent you have there.

I'm not out of ideas yet and have some new designs in the making, I'll update when I think I've got a worthy result.  Well as promised here's an update on an idea taken a little further. The front reel seat hood is fully encapsulated in wood trying to get a seamless flow from cork to front hood to reel seat.            Cheers
Beauty
They are stunning Chris. Almost too good to fish....
They are stunning Chris. Almost too good to fish.... Agreed,what nice work!!!!!!

Hello all  First off Happy New Year to all.  I've not been around too much as of late due to being quite busy. But I have a few minutes and wanted to share with you all what has kept me away......  In no particular order some of my custom rod work over the last few months.                                   Best wishes to all in the coming year.
WOW!!! very nice work
That is some nice work...wish mine looked like that!
beautiful work! it was nice to meet you at the gtg as well and I found we have a mutual acquaintance in Bruce L (girlfriends uncle) haha
Beautiful work as always Chris, your definitely a master of your trade.
Hey Chris Who makes those Strubel look alike seats? Mike told me but I cant remember. It's the oldtimers setting in. Good lookin bunch of cork and wood.
Wow!Outstanding work Chris Michaelangelo of the fishing world.
Excellent !
Good to see ya still around Chris.  Got quite the talent there I must say
Amazing work Chris!  Happy New Years to you also
beautiful work indeed !

Absolutely awesome Spiel !! I had some custom work done on a Kistler bait caster last year(new grip and guides) and I showed some of the pics of your work. He said, and I quote, "This guy isn't a rod builder, he's an artist" ............I agree with him. Happy new year to you !!! Health and happiness above all.    Paul
those rods aren't going to like down easter's very much!!!  nice work spiel!
Beautiful pieces of work.
Just in awe over the craftsmanship.  Fantastic work Chris!
Very nice heirloom work as always Chris, truly master pieces, cant believe the colours, and grains of some of the exotic wood reel seats
Some how "artist" just doesn't seem to be good enough to describe the beauty and quality of the workmanship. These are truly masterpieces!  Time well spent my friend and as beautiful as ever!
Very nice work as always can I send mine to you and get the official Spiel branding? Glad to see you are finally signing your work.   Art
He's just marking which one is his so he doesn't get them mixed up Art!!!  The workmanship just keeps getting better and better... I think you may have hit the end of the spectrum though Chris!
You should make duck calls. â€‹
incredible work dude! i want one haha
Great work Chris!
Wow!  Amazing work!
I see that sleek look of yours is well liked  Chris....the handles...you don't look too bad yourself  Your the master dude.
Lemke I think...something like that
